justification: The authors state that, to assess typing performance, one of the six representative metrics they selected was words per minute (WPM), which they use to capture typing speed.
In the same list of six metrics, the paper names inter-key interval (IKI) as a measure that reflects keystroke-to-keystroke timing, thereby operationalising inter-key timing.
The metric "amount of backspacing" is explicitly included among the six measures to quantify how users correct errors, linking backspacing counts to error-correction behaviour.
The authors include "error rate" in their six chosen metrics, using the percentage of erroneous characters as the operational measure of typing accuracy.
Among the six metrics is the "number of gaze shifts," which the text identifies as capturing aspects of users’ proofreading strategy while typing.
The list also contains the "gaze-on-keyboard time ratio," indicating it is employed to quantify how much visual attention is allocated to the keyboard during typing.
